diff_hunk:
@@ -89,10 +93,11 @@ def test_function_as_argument(self):
         cx = Variable(torch.randn(3, 20))
         lstm = nn.LSTMCell(10, 20)
 
-        def a_function(a, b):
+        @torch.jit.trace(nderivs=0, params=lstm.parameters())
body: If the parameters are specified when you annotate the function, it means that they can't change in future invocations of this function.  So why have parameters at all? If they can't change anyway, then just treat any reference to a variable that is not an input as a reference to a unchanging variable.

If they can't change anyway, then just treat any reference to a variable that is not an input as a reference to a unchanging variable.
